--- title: "Directed Acyclic Graphs" author: "Wisam Alsaba" format: html: code-line-numbers: true df-print: paged --- ---- #### **Assignment 5** ::: {.cell hash='05_dag_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_c6bbcd65e6c254aa4581b6882acf16bb'} ```{.r .cell-code} # Loading Required Libraries library(tidyverse) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` #> ── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ── #> ✔ dplyr 1.1.3 ✔ readr 2.1.4 #> ✔ forcats 1.0.0 ✔ stringr 1.5.1 #> ✔ ggplot2 3.4.4 ✔ tibble 3.2.1 #> ✔ lubridate 1.9.3 ✔ tidyr 1.3.0 #> ✔ purrr 1.0.2 #> ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── #> ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() #> ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() #> ℹ Use the conflicted package () to force all conflicts to become errors ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} library(dagitty) library(ggdag) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` #> #> Attaching package: 'ggdag' #> #> The following object is masked from 'package:stats': #> #> filter ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # Creating a DAG to visualize potential causal relationships between sales, parking spots, and location sales_dag <- dagify( sales ~ parking_spots, sales ~ location, parking_spots ~ location, # where location is the confounder labels = c( "sales" = "Sales", "parking_spots" = "Parking \n Spots", "location" = "Location" ) ) ggdag(sales_dag, use_labels = "label",text= FALSE) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](05_dag_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-1.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # Loading and examining customer satisfaction data sat_data <- readRDS('C:/Users/wisam/OneDrive/Desktop/Causal_Data_Science_Data/Data/customer_sat.rds') head(sat_data) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
````` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # Regression Analysis model1 <- lm(satisfaction ~ follow_ups, data = sat_data) summary(model1) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> #> Call: #> lm(formula = satisfaction ~ follow_ups, data = sat_data) #> #> Residuals: #> Min 1Q Median 3Q Max #> -12.412 -5.257 1.733 4.506 12.588 #> #> Coefficients: #> Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) #> (Intercept) 78.8860 4.2717 18.467 1.04e-10 *** #> follow_ups -3.3093 0.6618 -5.001 0.000243 *** #> --- #> Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #> #> Residual standard error: 7.923 on 13 degrees of freedom #> Multiple R-squared: 0.658, Adjusted R-squared: 0.6316 #> F-statistic: 25.01 on 1 and 13 DF, p-value: 0.0002427 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} model2 <- lm(satisfaction ~ follow_ups + subscription, data = sat_data) summary(model2) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> #> Call: #> lm(formula = satisfaction ~ follow_ups + subscription, data = sat_data) #> #> Residuals: #> Min 1Q Median 3Q Max #> -4.3222 -2.1972 0.3167 2.2667 3.9944 #> #> Coefficients: #> Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) #> (Intercept) 26.7667 6.6804 4.007 0.00206 ** #> follow_ups 2.1944 0.7795 2.815 0.01682 * #> subscriptionPremium 44.7222 5.6213 7.956 6.88e-06 *** #> subscriptionPremium+ 18.0722 2.1659 8.344 4.37e-06 *** #> --- #> Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #> #> Residual standard error: 2.958 on 11 degrees of freedom #> Multiple R-squared: 0.9597, Adjusted R-squared: 0.9487 #> F-statistic: 87.21 on 3 and 11 DF, p-value: 5.956e-08 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # Coefficients Comparison coef_comparison <- data.frame( Model = c("Model 1", "Model 2"), Intercept = c(coef(model1)[1], coef(model2)[1]), FollowUps = c(coef(model1)[2], coef(model2)[2]), PremiumPlus = c(0, coef(model2)[grep("subscriptionPremium\\+", names(coef(model2)))]), Elite = c(0, coef(model2)[grep("subscriptionElite", names(coef(model2)))]) ) print(coef_comparison) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> Model Intercept FollowUps PremiumPlus Elite #> Model 1 78.88605 -3.309302 0.00000 0 #> subscriptionPremium+ Model 2 26.76667 2.194444 18.07222 0 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # Data Visualization simps_not_cond <- ggplot(sat_data, aes(x = follow_ups, y = satisfaction)) + geom_point(alpha = 0.8) + stat_smooth(method = "lm", se = F) + labs(title = "Relationship: Follow-ups and Satisfaction", x = "Follow-ups", y = "Satisfaction") + theme_minimal() + theme(legend.position = "right") simps_cond <- ggplot(sat_data, aes(x = follow_ups, y = satisfaction, color = subscription)) + geom_point(alpha = 0.8) + stat_smooth(method = "lm", se = F, size = 1) + labs(title = "Relationship by Subscription Level", x = "Follow-ups", y = "Satisfaction", color = "Subscription") + theme_minimal() + theme(legend.position = "right") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` #> Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0. #> ℹ Please use `linewidth` instead. ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} simps_not_cond ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` #> `geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x' ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](05_dag_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-2.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} simps_cond ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` #> `geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x' ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](05_dag_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-3.png){width=672} ::: :::
